children: Necrotizing ulcerative gingivitis, previously known as Vincent angina (trench mouth), is an acute and painful oral condition characterized by fetid breath, loss or diminution of the interdental papilla (
), and necrotic sloughing of the gingiva (
). Necrotizing periodontal disease is a term that encompasses necrotizing ulcerative gingivitis and necrotizing ulcerative periodontitis.
